q: Tony Dungy Expects Michael Vick , Eagles To Reach Deal Courier Post- Tony Dungy , who has served as a mentor to Michael Vick , believes the quarterback will come to terms with the Eagles on a long-term contract. He is very grateful to Jeffrey Lurie and Andy Reid for believing in him and giving him an opportunity, Tony Dungy told the Courier Post. "He loves working with Marty Mornhinweg , he loves the young receivers and all the offensive firepower they have here. But more than anything I think he is just grateful they

was reluctant to endorse his former boss's assessment that the decision to draw down US troops shortly after the 2003 invasion of Iraq was "the most important failure in the execution of the war". I don't have enough confidence to say that that's right. I think that it's possible, Donald Rumsfeld told ABC News anchor Diane Sawyer . "We had[ an] enormous number of troops ready to go in. They had- we had off-ramps, if they weren't needed. "

Chris Bryant, who believes he may have been a victim of the phone hackers, said Friday he welcomed the decision to re-examine the case, adding that it should not have been closed last month. The evidence that this goes far deeper than one rotten apple has continued to stack up, and so a fresh pair of eyes looking at the case is very welcome, he said.
